sailpoint.object

Class IdentityTrigger

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.SailPointObject
        • sailpoint.object.IdentityTrigger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject, sailpoint.tools.xml.XMLReferenceTarget

    public class IdentityTrigger
extends SailPointObject
    An identity trigger is used used to determine when certain events happen to an identity. These are attached to some sort of action that will be executed when an identity meets the criteria of the trigger.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • load

        public void load()
        Description copied from class: SailPointObject
        This method traverses all members of a SailPointObject so that they are loaded and available to a session even after they have been detached. The default implementation does nothing. Subclasses must implement this functionality themselves if they need to provide it.
        Overrides:
        load in class SailPointObject

      • isInactive

        public boolean isInactive()
        Provides a dynamic way to check if a trigger is active. Note that this is separate from the isDisabled() method, which just checks the disabled boolean.

        Only RapidSetup currently supports isInactive() -- all other types will just return false.

        Returns:
        the value of the trigger's type's inactiveCheck lambda

      • matches

        public boolean matches(Identity prevIdentity,
                       Identity newIdentity,
                       IdentityMatcher matcher,
                       SailPointContext spContext)
                throws GeneralException
        Return whether the given previous and new identity states match this trigger. Note that a null previous identity indicates a creation and a null new identity indicates a deletion.
        Parameters:
        prevIdentity - The previous identity (null for a creation).
        newIdentity - The new identity (null for a deletion).
        matcher - The matcher to use to evaluate the selector.
        spContext - SailPointContext in case of Rule or RapidSetup type
        Returns:
        True if the trigger is matched by the given identities, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • createEvent

        public IdentityChangeEvent createEvent(Identity prev,
                                       Identity neu)
                                throws GeneralException
        Create an identity change event for this trigger given the previous and new identities. This should only be called if matches() returns true.

        Build an event based on the neu object and fall back to the previous if null.

        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • formatCause

        public java.lang.String formatCause(IdentityChangeEvent event)
                             throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Return a formatted message that describes what caused the given event.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException
